texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["This page contains documents related to the Roads Task Force (RTF) report published in July 2013."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Road network challenges map"}

An interactive map was created to give an overview of some of the challenges facing London's road network, for example, locations with the most congestion, worst air quality or highest collision rate.

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"Road network challenges map","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/road-network-challenges-map.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 5.35MB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"International case studies"}
This report identifies a sample of 37 projects where cities have delivered schemes with highway and urban realm benefits and sought to use innovation in their design and delivery.

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"Roads Review: Part A","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/roads-review-part-a.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 3.85MB","image":{}},{"title":"Roads Review: Part B 1-10","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/roads-review-part-b-1-10.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 1.91MB","image":{}},{"title":"Roads Review: Part B 11-18","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/roads-review-part-b-11-18.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 3.30MB","image":{}},{"title":"Roads Review: Part B 19-23","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/roads-review-part-b-19-23.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 1.46MB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"London's street family"}
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Theory, application \u0026 case studies"}
This document sets out the theory behind the development of the street types, and details case studies of specific locations in London which exemplify how they could be applied.

{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Better Streets Delivered"}
Schemes completed under the Better Streets programme are examples of public realm improvements that may be applied to future Roads Task Force initiatives.

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"Better Streets Delivered: Learning from completed schemes","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/better-streets-delivered.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 6.55MB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"GLA consultation"}
We consulted with stakeholders and the public in 2012 on how they think the road network should look going forward.

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"Response to the Roads Task Force consultation","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/response-to-rtf-consultation.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 3.99MB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
